Merging Files Automatically

Automatic merging is the process of merging a branch back to the trunk from archives that you have previously set up for automatic branching. You must set up archives for automatic branching to perform an automatic merge. When you have set up automatic branching, the merge command can determine the revision from which the branch originated, the trunk tip revision, and the branch tip revision. This eliminates having to specify these values when you execute the merge command.

After you have configured automatic branching, you can merge files automatically by selecting Actions | Show Merge.

For further information about how to merge revisions, refer to the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager User's Guide and the Serena ChangeMan Merge Tool online help.
